etymology.description: phonetic: 其(其) (qí, "his") + semantic: 斤(斤) (jīn, "axe") = indicates a specific object -> this
etymology.interpretation: 斯(斯) (sī) combines 其(其) (qí, "his") as a phonetic component suggesting pronunciation with 斤(斤) (jīn, "axe") as a semantic component initially related to chopping or cutting, leading to the function of pointing to a specific item or idea, hence the meaning "this."

examples.chinese: 斯时万物复苏(斯時萬物復甦)。
examples.english: At this moment, all things are awakening.

examples.chinese: 斯城风光旖旎(斯城風光旖旎)，吸引无数游客(吸引無數遊客)。
examples.pinyin: Sī chéng fēngguāng yǐnǐ, xīyǐn wúshù yóukè.
examples.english: The enchanting scenery of this city attracts countless tourists.
